bibl.title: Letter from H.O. Benson to John J. Moran, [August] 1914

div1.p: Moran is ordered to report for physical examination before receiving new orders.

div1.head: Letter from H.O. Benson to John J. Moran, [August] 1914
div1.opener:
In Answer Refer to File No._______________
03-6148
WAR DEPARTMENT,
OFFICE OF THE QUARTERMASTER GENERAL OF THE ARMY,
WASHINGTON.
div1.p:
From: The Acting Quartermaster General of the Army.
To: Capt. John J. Moran, Q.M.C., U.S.A.,
Depot Quartermaster, New York City, N.Y.
Subject: Physical Examination and Qualification Card.

list.item:
1. Recommendation has this date been made to the
Adjutant General of the Army for orders relieving you from your
present duties for extended field service.

2. It is requested that you be examined by an Army
Surgeon before leaving your station, to determine your physical
fitness for duty overseas, which physical report you will present
at Port of Embarkation, when reporting for transportation overseas.

3. You are directed to take with you to Port of
Embarkation Officer's Qualification Card (Form C.C.P. 1101) in
duplicate, rated according to instructions contained in Circular
No. 7, O.Q.M.G., February 18, 1918, and enclosed in sealed envelope.

4. Concerning the two “Locator” cards enclosed
herewith, after having been filled out, one should be placed within
the sealed envelope, the other attached to the outside.

5. This action is being taken in accordance with
Paragraph 5 Cable No. SOS 60, dated August 29, 1918,
from General Pershing, Item - - - - -, which item number
you will take with you to show the Debarking Official upon arrival
in France.

div1.closer:
By authority of the Acting Quartermaster General: H. O. Benson,
Major, Q.M.C. MJ
2 Incls.
(2 Locator Cards)
S-3943
By D.R.WOLVERTON
D.R.WOLVERTON,
Captain, Q.M.C.
